definition: to cook on a slow fire/to extract by heating/to decoct/to endure

sentences.english: Deaden the gnaw of hunger that way.
sentences.chinese: 借此来缓和一下饥饿的煎熬。

sentences.english: Worse than the total agony of being in love?
sentences.chinese: 还有比忍受爱情煎熬还要惨得事么？

sentences.english: Fett's armor and body were extremely battered by his ordeal in the Sarlacc.
sentences.chinese: 在沙拉克中的煎熬使费特的盔甲和身躯都饱受摧残。

sentences.english: Debt should be a painful ache until it is eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 债务在其销除之前应该是一种煎熬难耐。

sentences.english: But that I burn much more in boiling sweat.
sentences.chinese: 反而更把我煎熬得热汗淋淋。

sentences.english: Many were the times I lost consciousness and was confronted with death during those ordeals.
sentences.chinese: 好几次我失去了意识，而在这些煎熬期间面对死亡。

sentences.english: He spent an anxious day in the lockup.
sentences.chinese: 他在拘留所里焦急地煎熬了一天。

sentences.english: Zan hairpin a zoned waves surging, the bitter suffering from hate.
sentences.chinese: 簪钗一划浪滔滔，从此恨海苦煎熬。

sentences.english: Investigators will give administration officials the grilling of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 国会指派的调查人员将使当局的官员们备受煎熬。

sentences.english: Ma Dong and Zong Feng were being experienced kink and after sufferring, mother child admit eventually.
sentences.chinese: 马东和宗凤经历了着纠结和煎熬后，母子终于相认。

sentences.english: We have a little more than a month to go of this madness.
sentences.chinese: 我们还得在这样的疯狂中煎熬一个多月。

sentences.english: “It was tough to see the Kings turn it around when I left,” says Mitch.
sentences.chinese: 我离开时，看着国王队，很煎熬。

sentences.english: The violent spirit conflict is torturing his all inditing course.
sentences.chinese: 这种强烈的精神冲突煎熬着他的整个创作过程。
煎熬中的我王演奏哈利路亚。

sentences.english: But each time again there was a horrid twinge of conscience.
sentences.chinese: 但同时，每一次又都要承受良心上的煎熬。

sentences.english: Your tactile sense takes a crucifying you never dreamed possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的触觉会感受到前所未有的煎熬。

definition: a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
